get.description: Get all attached object references from the Threeport database.

parameters.description: attached object reference search by name
parameters.name: name

post.description: Add a new attached object reference to the Threeport database.
post.summary: adds a new attached object reference.

get.description: Get a particular attached object reference from the database.

put.description:
Replace a attached object reference in the database.  All required fields must be provided.
If any optional fields are not provided, they will be null post-update.
Note: This API endpint is for updating attached object reference objects only.
Request bodies that include related objects will be accepted, however
the related objects will not be changed.  Call the patch or put method for
each particular existing object to change them.
put.summary: updates an existing attached object reference by replacing the entire object.

delete.description: Delete a attached object reference by ID from the database.

patch.description:
Update a attached object reference in the database.  Provide one or more fields to update.
Note: This API endpint is for updating attached object reference objects only.
Request bodies that include related objects will be accepted, however
the related objects will not be changed.  Call the patch or put method for
each particular existing object to change them.
patch.summary: updates specific fields for an existing attached object reference.

parameters.name: name

post.description: Add a new kubernetes runtime definition to the Threeport database.
post.summary: adds a new kubernetes runtime definition.

get.description: Get a particular kubernetes runtime definition from the database.

put.description:
Replace a kubernetes runtime definition in the database.  All required fields must be provided.
If any optional fields are not provided, they will be null post-update.
Note: This API endpint is for updating kubernetes runtime definition objects only.
Request bodies that include related objects will be accepted, however
the related objects will not be changed.  Call the patch or put method for
each particular existing object to change them.
put.summary: updates an existing kubernetes runtime definition by replacing the entire object.

delete.description: Delete a kubernetes runtime definition by ID from the database.

patch.description:
Update a kubernetes runtime definition in the database.  Provide one or more fields to update.
Note: This API endpint is for updating kubernetes runtime definition objects only.
Request bodies that include related objects will be accepted, however
the related objects will not be changed.  Call the patch or put method for
each particular existing object to change them.
patch.summary: updates specific fields for an existing kubernetes runtime definition.

WorkloadInstanceID.description: The workload definition this resource belongs to.

AccessKeyID.description: The access key ID credentials for the AWS account.

AccountID.description: The account ID for the AWS account.

AwsEksKubernetesRuntimeDefinitions.description: The cluster instances deployed in this AWS account.

DefaultAccount.description: If true is the AWS Account used if none specified in a definition.

DefaultRegion.description: The region to use for AWS managed services if not specified.

ExternalId.description:
The ExternalId to use when assuming a RoleArn for the AWS account. This is
automatically generated by the API server if RoleArn is set.

Name.description: The unique name of an AWS account.

RoleArn.description: The RoleArn to assume for the AWS account.

SecretAccessKey.description: The secret key credentials for the AWS account.

AWSAccountID.description: The AWS account in which the EKS cluster is provisioned.

AwsEksKubernetesRuntimeInstances.description: The AWS EKS kubernetes runtime instances derived from this definition.

DefaultNodeGroupInitialSize.description: The number of nodes in the default initial node group.

DefaultNodeGroupInstanceType.description: The AWS instance type for the default initial node group.

DefaultNodeGroupMaximumSize.description: The maximum number of nodes the default initial node group should have.

DefaultNodeGroupMinimumSize.description: The minimum number of nodes the default initial node group should have.

KubernetesRuntimeDefinitionID.description: The kubernetes runtime definition for an EKS cluster in AWS.

Name.description: An arbitrary name for the definition.

ProfileID.description:
The profile to associate with the definition.  Profile is a named
standard configuration for a definition object.

TierID.description:
The tier to associate with the definition.  Tier is a level of
criticality for access control.

ZoneCount.description: The number of zones the cluster should span for availability.

AwsEksKubernetesRuntimeDefinitionID.description: The definition that configures this instance.

CreationAcknowledged.description:
Used by controllers to acknowledge deletion and indicate that deletion
reconciliation has begun so that subsequent reconciliation attempts can
act accordingly.

CreationConfirmed.description: Used by controllers to confirm deletion of an object.

CreationFailed.description: Gets set to true if creation process fails.

DeletionAcknowledged.description:
Used by controllers to acknowledge deletion and indicate that deletion
reconciliation has begun so that subsequent reconciliation attempts can
act accordingly.

DeletionConfirmed.description: Used by controllers to confirm deletion of an object.

DeletionScheduled.description:
Used to inform reconcilers that an object is being deleted so they may
complete delete reconciliation before actually deleting the object from the database.

InterruptReconciliation.description:
InterruptReconciliation is used by the controller to indicated that future
reconcilation should be interrupted.  Useful in cases where there is a
situation where future reconciliation could be descructive such as
spinning up more infrastructure when there is a unresolved problem.

KubernetesRuntimeInstanceID.description: The kubernetes runtime instance associated with the AWS EKS cluster.

Name.description: An arbitrary name the instance

Reconciled.description: Indicates if object is considered to be reconciled by the object's controller.

Region.description:
The AWS Region in which the cluster is provisioned.  This field is
stored in the instance (as well as definition) since a change to the
definition will not move a cluster.

ResourceInventory.description: An inventory of all AWS resources for the EKS cluster.

Status.description:
The status of the instance.
TODO: use a custom type

AwsAccountID.description: The AWS account in which the RDS instance will be provisioned.

Name.description: An arbitrary name for the definition.

ProfileID.description:
The profile to associate with the definition.  Profile is a named
standard configuration for a definition object.

PublicReadAccess.description:
When true, objects in the bucket are publicly readable by anyone - for use
cases such as storing static assets for public websites.  When false,
only the workload attached to an AWSObjectStorageBucketInstance and the AWS users
on the account may access the bucket for read or write.

TierID.description:
The tier to associate with the definition.  Tier is a level of
criticality for access control.

WorkloadBucketEnvVar.description:
The environment variable key that the workload is expecting to reference
for the name of the S3 bucket managed by threeport.

WorkloadServiceAccountName.description:
The name of the Kubernetes service account for the workload that will
access the S3 bucket.  Used to provide secure access using IAM roles for
service accounts (IRSA).

AwsObjectStorageBucketDefinitionID.description: The definition that configures this instance.
